comments.content: The blue manakin or swallow-tailed manakin (Chiroxiphia caudata) is a small species of bird in the Pipridae family. It is found in north-eastern Argentina, southern and south-eastern Brazil, and Paraguay.

description: Earl Oremus Health Care Rant:  FAKE HEALTH CARE!  FAKE HEALTH CARE!  Seven years of Republicans whining, complaining, reviling President Obama, and vilifying the Affordable Healthcare Act.  Fifty two Republican votes over those years to repeal ACA.  Seven years of promises of the wonderful new Republican system they would provide if only they had the votes. A year and a half of Trump campaigning on constant promises of a system with better coverage and lower costs.  And what do they cobble together at the last minute?  A bill that proposes to yank health care away 20 or so million people served by ACA and Medicare.  A bill that transforms one 60+ year old married couple's premiums from $750 to $17,000 per year.  A bill so stupid, stinking and dysfunctional that even the Republicans themselves couldn't hold their Pinochio noses long enough to vote for it.  Seven damn years of their screaming about how horrible ACA is.  And with all that time to propose something productive that would fix the system, they are incapable of even bringing a health care bill to a vote. And these are the people we have voted into control of the House, the Senate, the White House, the Supreme Court, our economy, our foreign relations, our environment, our efforts to curb global warming, our defense, and the core values that define our democracy  ... in short, the issues that will decide our country's future for the next generation.  These people seem heartless when dealing with the less fortunate, mindless when it comes to using evidence and rational thinking to solve problems, shameless when it comes to using their power to benefit themselves, and soul-less when advantaging their 1% campaign funders at the expense of the rest of our nation.  Sad to say, it looks like it's not just Fake Health Care folks; it looks like it may just be four years of Fake Government, too.

The burnt cookie would still taste burnt... and who has cookies in the jar two days later?? The marshmallows in the brown sugar works great, though. No crumbs from a slice of bread, or moldy apple slices (both are often suggested to keep brown sugar soft). Even better, when it's time to add new marshmallows, you can still eat the old ones!

description: Kathy Hoessly Cullinan I listened as they called my President a Muslim.  I listened as they called him and his family a pack of monkeys.  I listened as they said he wasn't born here.  I watched as they blocked every single path to progress that they could.  I saw the pictures of him as Hitler.  I watched them shut down the government and hurt the entire nation twice.  I watched them turn their backs on every opportunity to open worthwhile  dialogue.  I watched them say that they would not even listen to any choice for Supreme  Court no matter who the nominee was.  I listened as they openly said that they will oppose him at every turn.  I watched as they did just that.  I listened.  I watched.  I paid attention.  Now, I'm being called on to be tolerant.  To move forward.  To denounce protesters.  To "Get over it."  To accept this...  I will not.  I will do my part to make sure this great American mistake becomes the  embarrassing footnote of our history that it deserves to be.  I will do this as quickly as possible every chance I get.  I will do my part to limit the damage that this man can do to my country.  I will watch his every move and point out every single mistake and misdeed in a loud and proud voice.  I will let you know in a loud voice every time this man backs away from a promise he made to them.  Them. The people who voted for him.  The ones who sold their souls and prayed for him to win.  I will do this so that they never forget.  And they will hear me.  They will see it in my eyes when I look at them.  They will hear it in my voice when I talk to them.  They will know that I know who they are.  They will know that I know what they are.  Do not call for my tolerance. I've tolerated all I can.  Now it's their turn to tolerate ridicule.  Be aware, make no mistake about it, every single thing that goes wrong in  our country from this day forward is now Trump's fault just as much as they thought it was Obama's.  I find it unreasonable for them to expect from me what they were entirely unwilling to give.  -Jeremy Mitchell

comments.content: How I love Jane Goodall!  She was once one of my teachers in zoology at the University of Nairobi.  She is not only a genius, but one of the wisest, most compassionate people on earth today.  Take the master class!  You will never forget it.

I learned that when Disney was building the Tree of Life in the Animal Kingdom park and they realized a chimpanzee was not one of the animals carved into it, she got to choose where they placed it. She also chose to have the oldest one replicated. That particular chimp was greying..... it's the only animal on the tree that has a color other than brown.

I've followed and studies your work for years  # DrJaneGoodall  . You inspire me to put nature first before rationalization of my actions or misunderstandings as a human. We weren't here first and we share this planet, Might as well conserve, converse and comply.

That woman is 83!  She looks 65!  I'm glad she's sharing what she's observed and learned.  That's the best we all can do.  Instead of bemoaning the human race's propensity to destroy itself or the technicalities of whether she is right or wrong why don't we do our little part to be part of the solution to our planet's woes.  Die with a good conscience for having done your part at least.

NO!! You DO NOT use soap on a cast iron not even for rust spots!! Use a scouring pad and salt!! Rinse it well, set on the stove on low to medium heat to dry then coat with oil.
If you know anything about cast or stone ware you know NEVER to use soap

I am probably the only one in the world, except my grandmother,  that washes my cast iron skillet just like any other dish, hot soapy water, rinse, dry on a hot burner. To those that are mortified by this, I have done it for over 20 years now,  and have no problems....

I only use cast iron skillets. If you take care of them they will last forever! I have one that was my grandmothers. NEVER use soap. Rinse with hot water to clean, pour some salt and cut half a potato. Rub, rub, rub. Then just rinse with hot water. Bur ... See More

Oh the debate over cast iron. Some of you are over reacting. Cast iron is not a delicate material. Clean it how you want too. Your not going to wreck it. I've pulled pans out of a junk pill with an inch of rust in them. Cleaned them up with the side grinder. Good as new.
And as i always have to remind myself, stay out of the comment section. Who are all you people that feel the need to post 20 replies to a video about a pan?
This was seriously super helpful. I have always wanted to cook with cast iron but was too intimidated. You have me sold. Thank you for doing this.

In a properly seasoned cast iron pan, one that has been rubbed with oil and heated repeatedly, the oil has already broken down into a plastic-like substance that has bonded to the surface of the metal. This is what gives well-seasoned cast iron its non-stick properties, and as the material is no longer actually an oil, the surfactants in dish soap should not affect it.

No. Just... No. You're overthinking the whole process of cleaning and maintaining. Throw it in a fire or in the oven on clean cycle if you have to strip it down for cleaning... All you need after that is hot water and a plastic scrubber. If you REALLY  ... See More

This might possibly be the worst way to season a cast iron skillet. While seasoning the pan in a 500 degree oven to "burn off" the excess oil, it filled my entire house up with smoke and set off my fire alarms for about 15 minutes. Now we are all siting in the house with every freaking window wide open in January. This video is bullshit.

If you use it regularly, you don't need to worry about "storing" it. I use mine pretty much everyday and haven't had to season them in quite a while. Bottom line- being owned by a cast iron skillet is as much work as you want it to be.
My parents have been using the same set of cast iron pans for over 50 years and I promise you CAN use soap on them. They're nonstick and never rust. The food always tastes great, too.

It makes me insane when I see people (ok, I mean my hubby) use soap on cast iron. When used properly in the first place (heat pan first, then add butter/oil, let oil/fat heat up, THEN cook food) it becomes non-stick. Just wipe clean with papertowel. Avoid cooking with red sauce as this will remove the oil seasoning. I love my cast iron!

description: Mary Jacobs Copied from post written by Allee Michelle Monheim:   Tonight I had a conversation with a man I've known and considered a friend for most of my adult life. He told me that "we" should be glad that white supremacists and nazis are exposing themselves so we can see them for who they are.   Thing is, they've been exposing themselves to me for a long time.   They exposed themselves to me in junior high when my friend asked me not to tell her grandparents I was Jewish, or they wouldn't let her hang out with me.   They exposed themselves to me when I showed up to Hebrew school one day and was sent home because someone had hopped our fence and drawn swastikas on our Temple.   They did it a few years later when I was teaching at that same Hebrew school and I had to send my own students home because someone did it again.   They did it when I had to speak at a school board meeting in 2005 when I was a senior in high school because Jewish students weren't being allowed to make up tests they missed for the High Holidays.   And again, when the principal of my high school said the High Holidays weren't important, in front of a room full of students after my friend, another Jewish student, asked why we didn't get those days off like other schools in Southern California (yes, this all took place in Southern California. In LA County, no less).  And again, in October of last year, when I went to a show at a bar and a holocaust denier followed me around all night after I told him that he needed to stop talking to me because I was Jewish and didn't want to hear it.   And I've had it easy compared to most - I'm still a white girl who lives in a blue state. There's so much I don't have to deal with, even with everything I do deal with.   I tried to explain this to my friend - that they've never been hiding, they've just been easier for everyone else to ignore. I said I've never been glad, that I couldn't ever be glad. He told me we were all on the same side and I...was just so terribly disappointed.   Here's the thing. You can't be on someone's side if you're not listening to them. Every time these nazi rallies happen, it hurts. And it hurts all over again when someone who has never had to deal with it tells you how you should be feeling.   "Shallow understanding from people of good will is more frustrating than absolute misunderstanding from people of ill will." - MLK.

OMG, we don't even start school until MONDAY. Our district flat out has it in for us.
We are experiencing the middle school bullies this week.  Breaks my heart how mean some children can be.
Next year, please make this PSA in the first week of August for those of us whose kids have already been back for 2 weeks! üòú  *tries to remember if she overplanned the first weekend

Yes, this is all about what the children need after the first week.  I mean I could totally handle a crowded restaurant at the end of the first week, with all of the smells and the traffic and the parking lot.  Really, I could.  But for the children - all for them - I will curl up on the couch with a blanket and pizza and a movie.  All for the children.

This also holds true if your mom, wife, husband is a teacher...the end of the first week of school, we are DONE.  Spouses, kids, family of said teacher - make him/her bath, pour glass of preferred beverage, and order in.

Both of my kids came home from school and fell asleep on the couch for two hours.. we ended up cancelling our Friday night plans and watched "This Is Us"  reruns the rest of the night... It was just what we all needed!
This also goes for teachers!  Day 3 of our first full week and I am completely exhausted.  I may or may not have fed my kids Taco Bell for dinner.  We never eat Taco Bell.

We have a soccer tournament our first weekend. 3 days of soccer.  I have already wept about that little fact. My MS kiddo, who will go from leaving at 8:25 for school to leaving at 7:15 will be so much fun to sit on the sidelines with and watch his brother.  And, I am sure it will be 1 thousand degrees out because tournaments are played in either 1 thousand degrees or when it's snowraining.

I expect nothing from my kids the first 2 weeks of school. Their rooms are a mess and their chores are not done, but that's ok. They'll get caught up when they get re-acclimated to school life. It's hard for us teachers too.  üòå

description: Jen Hatmaker Dear ones, this is my yearly PSA because I am here for you and sometimes we forget things:   By the end of your cherubs' first week of school, they are:   D  O  N  E.  Listen to me: do not go to "celebration dinner" Friday night, do not go to the late football game, do not decide to run errands, do not make big plans, do not ask one million questions, do not force them to talk about everything, do not attempt to execute ANYTHING AT ALL in which your expectations include children who are pleasant.   They are like overfilled balloons. Should you accidentally push them too hard by, for example, asking them to chew with their mouths closed or making suggestions for dinner or any other unreasonable pressure, they will violently burst and ruin the thing you were dumbly considering as a Fun Family Situation.   Your Friday night plans after the first week of school need to involve a couch, some blankets, a pizza, and a movie. That is it. That is all anyone can handle. Your kid will make it past the first twenty minutes tops. They are all goners. Do not put them in the car and try to go somewhere, because they will turn your car into the Crazy Train.   Ditto: Saturday morning plans.   Ditto: That whole first weekend.   Your mission should you choose to accept it because you are a Smart Person is to do and plan nothing the first weekend after school starts. Let their little bodies catch up. They are exhausted after their summer of being sloth children who now have to think and pay attention for seven hours a day.   Plus, first week of school emotions. Plus, change. Plus, new scenarios and teachers and students and schedules. Plus, that one mean girl. Plus, figuring out where to sit at lunch. Plus, all the new rules. Plus, recess politics. Plus, homework. Plus, did their clothes/shoes/hair/backpack fit in right. Plus, the bus. Plus, they learned the F word on the playground and everything feels weird.   Trust your friend Jen: couch, blanket, pizza, movie. That's your weekend plan. Cancel everything else. You're welcome. Matt Waddell Joani Shawn Nicole Amber

Another source if you are still sussing out this issue:  https://www.vox.com/.../us-gun-violence-statistics-maps...

description: Jen Hatmaker Yesterday after the church massacre, I was all fire and fury and rage and wailing. Ready to fight. Ready to march. Ready to burn down the establishment. Ready to chain myself to the doors of the White House.   Today, my adrenaline has receded and I am sick with sadness. My heart is so grieved. I am so sad and sorrowful for that sweet little town, that sweet little church. Brandon and I cannot quit staring at the TV as they mourn in shock. We are crushed. Again. I don't even kn ... ow how to pray.   I'm too tired to debate, so I won't do it. I'm just going to speak to those of you who want to see common sense gun reform. Not take all the guns. Not abolish the 2nd amendment. I will not fight your straw men. I just want basic common sense reform. I am a hunter's daughter, a hunter's wife, and the mom of three hunters. I am sending a son to college for Wildlife Management. I am not anti-gun. I am anti-gun violence.   If you are too, see the link below to join the work of  Everytown for Gun Safety  who is on the ground pushing for common sense gun reform. They have the numbers of your congressmen/senators and petitions to sign and plenty of research if you are in the inquiry phase.   You can fight all you want in the comments. I'm not here for it today. Zero engagement from me. Just know it. I'm weary of the debate. Yesterday was the 307th mass shooting in the US this year on the 307th day of the year. I'm done arguing that the sky is not falling.   If you want to join the movement for basic gun reform, this is a good place to start.   We are so sorry, Sutherland Springs.    https://everytown.org/act/   See More

Jorge Velazquez, my father, died a hero alongside Rick Rescola and Godwin Forde. May they rest in peace
His legacy still lives on. 2700 souls are still alive and breathing because of this angel's undeterred courage and determination. Rest in power.
